content.description:
Sit start under the straight vertical face. Powerful moves lead to the main face. Use the obvious slots to gain the flake roof. Then dive into the fun top face. (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering) 

  The flow of the stream can raise or lower the start of this problem, or take the landing away entirely.
content.location: Right side of the confederate wall. Obvious shear wall in a shallow alcove.

content.description:
Sit Start on the blunt arete and work up good ledges left of the crack.  Follow the good ledges crossing the crack to a fun, easy top out.  (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering) 

  Depending on where the water is flowing through the streambed, this climb may be above water. As of 2015 there is no solid ground below this route.
content.protection: ?? Depending on where the water is flowing through the stream bed, this climb may be above the shallow Merritt Creek. As of 2015 there is no solid ground below this route.
content.location: Between the Gorilla Warfare arete and Universal Truth.

content.description: Stand start on high jug. Pull the roof then head up and left to the giant ledge. (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering)
content.location: Left side of Confederate Wall. On the face right of the obvious Gorilla Warfare arete.

content.description: Squat start in horizontal slot jug below roof. Move up to slopey ledge, then crip your way straight up to the slopey top out. Arete is off. Don't cheat the topout by going around the arete. (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering)
content.location: Left side of Confederate Wall. Slightly overhanging face left of the Gorilla Warefare arete.

content.description: Squat start low on the arete. Follow arete with awesome jugs. At the upper ledge, don't wimp out and traverse right, be bold and dyno to the top of the corner on How Dirty Boys Get Clean. (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering)
content.location: Left side of the Confederate Wall. The obvious arete near the end of the approach trail.

content.description: Squat start low on Arete. Follow arete with awesome jugs. At the upper ledge, follow it right to an easy top out. (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering)
content.location: Left side of the Confederate Wall. The obvious arete near the end of the approach trail.

content.description:
Sit start left hand on slopey rail, right hand on small arete. Move up through good jugs until you get to the huecos. Negotiate the top section with the crack, some huecos, and some side pulls. (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering) 

  Depending on where the water is flowing through the streambed, this climb may be above water. As of 2015 there is no solid ground below this route.
content.protection: ??  Depending on where the water is flowing through the streambed, this climb may be above water. As of 2015 there is no solid ground below this route.
content.location: Right of the Gorilla Warfare arete. Also right of the small shelf that allows access to Orange Against the Sky and Gorilla Warfare.

content.description:
Awkward sit start on small arete. Move up staying out of the crack. Balance your way up the top headwall. (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering) 

  Depending on where the water is flowing through the streambed, this climb may be above water. As of 2015 there is no solid ground below this route.
content.protection: ??  Depending on where the water is flowing through the stream bed, this climb may be above the shallow Merritt Creek. As of 2015 there is no solid ground below this route.
content.location: Right of the Gorilla Warfare arete. Also right of the small shelf that allows access to Orange Against the Sky and Gorilla Warfare.

content.description: Cool, short, steep problem on the way down to the Confederate wall. SDS that works up and over the left side of the face. The climb uses only the face, not the rocks to the left. If you use them, you're not doing the climb (see photos)
content.protection: 2 pads, spotter. Slightly steep landing with potential to roll.
content.location: From Skyline Parkway, walk down to the base of the artificial rock retaining wall. Stay on this side of the creek. Walk parallel to the creek for a few hundred feet, and the rock is on your left.

content.description: start in the obvious dihedral at the right end of the confederate wall. follow this dihedral up then shoot left for the giant horizontal flake and finish straight up.
content.location: furthest climb on the right end of the confederate wall.

climbs.name: Better Than a Stick in the Eye

content.description:
Sit start under a line of three large holes. Work up and around the right side of the roof. Follow the crack stemming onto the slopey top of the big roof. Pull over smaller roofs to the top. (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering) 

  The flow of the stream can raise or lower the start of this problem, or take the landing away entirely.
content.location: Right side of Confederate Wall. The left side of the shallow alcove containing Universal Truth.

content.description:
Stand start on a slopey ledge on right side of face. Follow good, sharp holds up and left leading to a sidepull flake. (From Peter's Guide to Duluth Bouldering) 

  Some loose rock in middle of face, topout is the crux.
content.location: The furthest downstream route, also the farthest left rock on the Confederate Wall. If you follow the approach trail past the rock bridge, this is the first wall you come to.

content.description: A long and tall cliff line containing many cool easy climbs.
